title: War!
subTitle: The Hun Invasion
description: When the Ostrogoths try to expand their territory into regions controlled by the Huns, the Huns respond by exploding into Eastern Europe. Most of the Teutonic tribes are enslaved, forced to give up land, or flee to Rome for sanctuary.

title: A loss
subTitle: Alans
description: Enslaved by the Huns

title: A loss
subTitle: Ostrogoths
description: Enslaved by the Huns

title: Vassalage
subTitle: Visgoths
description: The Visgoths are granted land in Rome as they flee the Huns. However, they soon become unhappy with the arrangments...

title: A loss
subTitle: Gepids
description: Enslaved by the Huns

title: A loss
subTitle: Khwarizm
description: Enslaved by the White Huns

title: A loss
subTitle: Brahui
description: Enslaved by the White Huns

title: Coalition
subTitle: The Suevi & Vandals
description: Pursued by the Huns, the Marco-manni, Quadi, & Siling and Asing Vandals join forces before fleeing to Rome

title: Vassalage
subTitle: The Suevi & Vandals
description: Unable to stop the onslaught of the Huns, the Suvei & Vandal coalition appeal to Rome for sanctuary.

title: Battle of Adrianople
description: The combined Visgoth and remnant Ostrogoth cavalries crush the Roman legions, marking the end of Rome's military dominance in Europe

title: Resurgance!
subTitle: British
description: The British peoples regain their political identity as Rome begins to pull out of Brittania.

title: Independence!
subTitle: Kingdom of Iberia
description: To ease conflicts with Persia in order to respond to events in the North; Rome agrees to give the Kingdom of Iberia its independence.

title: Independence!
subTitle: Kingdom of Armenia
description: To ease conflicts with Persia in order to respond to events in the North; Rome agrees to give the Kingdom of Armenia its independence.

title: War!
subTitle: Slavic Expansion
description: As the Huns overrun the Teutonic world, the Slavs edge westward, taking advantage of the chaos

title: A loss
subTitle: Lombards
description: Overrun by the Slavs

title: War!
subTitle: The Germanic Expansion
description: Under pressure by the Huns, many Germanic tribes begin expanding their borders into Roman lands. Rome's armies are only strong enough to slow them down. Germanic vassals of Rome take to opportunity to claim their own pieces of Rome's territory.

title: Independence!
subTitle: The Suevi & Vandals
description: With Rome's armies too weakened to stop them, the Suevi & Vandal tribes settle in modern Spain.

title: Execution
subTitle: Stilicho the Vandal
description: Stilicho the Vandal is executed by Emperor Honorius out of fear of his growing influence. Stilicho's death weakened Rome and emboldened the Germanic invaders.

subTitle: The Sack of Rome
description: With Stilicho dead and Emperor Honorius unwilling to defend the city, King Aleric of the Visgoths marches on Rome, sacking the city and defacing Rome's reputation.

title: Independence!
subTitle: Visgoths
description: After a decade of nomadic raiding and pillaging of Rome, the Visgoths settle in modern-day Western France.
